title: Way to a New World
creator_contributor_role: Australian National Film Board, production company
Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Papua New Guinea - Social life and customs
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Economic assistance, Australian - Papua New Guinea
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Papua New Guinea - Economic conditions
abstract: Produced by the Commonwealth Film Unit in co-operation with the Department of Territories - depicts the changes in the socio-economic life of Papua New Guinea's indigenous people.
description: The old and the new in Papua New Guinea. The traditional way of life in the villages; trade with other villages, the belief in magic, raising garden crops, management of village affairs by the old men in secret, feasts and sing-sings, the initiation of the young men. The new ways; opportunities for education, improved health and child welfare, the introduction of cash crops and native cooperation associations, the formation of elected Local Government Councils.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: VoD Program; B2003003; Papua New Guinea: 40 Years of Independence; Active; 2014
